// PersoneelController.java (modified for PUT and DELETE - in-memory)
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.DeleteMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PutMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ResponseStatus;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Optional;

// Assuming Personeel class is defined as in Lesson 2 - Part 2

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/personeel")
public class PersoneelController {
    // Re-using the in-memory list and nextId from Lesson 2 - Part 2 for demonstration
    private List personeel = new ArrayList<>();
    private Long nextId = 1L;

    public PersoneelController() {
        personeel.add(new Personeel(nextId++, "Personeel Title 1", "Personeel Author 1"));
        personeel.add(new Personeel(nextId++, "Personeel Title 2", "Personeel Author 2"));
    }

    @GetMapping
    public List getAllPersoneel() {
        return personeel;
    }

    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel getPersoneelById(@PathVariable Long id) {
        return personeel.stream()
                .filter(personeelItem -> personeelItem.getId().equals(id))
                .findFirst()
                .orElse(null);
    }

    @PostMapping
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.CREATED)
    public Personeel createPersoneel(@RequestBody Personeel personeel) {
        personeel.setId(nextId++);
        this.personeel.add(personeel);
        return personeel;
    }

    @PutMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel updatePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Personeel updatedPersoneel) {
        return personeel.stream()
                .filter(personeelItem -> personeelItem.getId().equals(id))
                .findFirst()
                .map(personeelItem -> {
                    personeelItem.setTitle(updatedPersoneel.getTitle());
                    personeelItem.setAuthor(updatedPersoneel.getAuthor());
                    return personeelItem;
                })
                .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Personeel not found"));
    }

    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT)
    public void deletePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id) {
        if (!personeel.removeIf(personeelItem -> personeelItem.getId().equals(id))) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Personeel not found");
        }
    }
}

@Entity Annotation

// Personeel.java (Entity)
import jakarta.persistence.Entity;
import jakarta.persistence.GeneratedValue;
import jakarta.persistence.GenerationType;
import jakarta.persistence.Id;

@Entity
public class Personeel {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.IDENTITY)
    private Long id;
    private String title;
    private String author;

    // constructors, getters, setters
    public Personeel() {}

    public Personeel(Long id, String title, String author) {
        this.id = id;
        this.title = title;
        this.author = author;
    }

    public Long getId() {
        return id;
    }

    public void setId(Long id) {
        this.id = id;
    }

    public String getTitle() {
        return title;
    }

    public void setTitle(String title) {
        this.title = title;
    }

    public String getAuthor() {
        return author;
    }

    public void setAuthor(String author) {
        this.author = author;
    }
}

Lesson 3 - Part 5

// PersoneelController.java (modified for JPA Repository)
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.DeleteMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PutMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ResponseStatus;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;
import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;

import java.util.List;

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/personeel")
public class PersoneelController {

    // 1. Inject PersoneelRepository into PersoneelController
    @Autowired
    private PersoneelRepository personeelRepository;

    // 2. Replace in-memory list with repository calls
    // 3. Update GET endpoints to use repository.findAll()
    @GetMapping
    public List getAllPersoneel() {
        return personeelRepository.findAll();
    }

    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel getPersoneelById(@PathVariable Long id) {
        return personeelRepository.findById(id).orElse(null);
    }

    // 4. Update POST endpoint to use repository.save()
    @PostMapping
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.CREATED)
    public Personeel createPersoneel(@RequestBody Personeel personeel) {
        return personeelRepository.save(personeel);
    }

    // 5. Update PUT endpoint to use repository.save()
    @PutMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel updatePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Personeel updatedPersoneel) {
        return personeelRepository.findById(id)
                .map(personeel -> {
                    personeel.setTitle(updatedPersoneel.getTitle());
                    personeel.setAuthor(updatedPersoneel.getAuthor());
                    return personeelRepository.save(personeel);
                })
                .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("Personeel not found"));
    }

    // 6. Update DELETE endpoint to use repository.deleteById()
    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT)
    public void deletePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id) {
        if (!personeelRepository.existsById(id)) {
            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Personeel not found");
        }
        personeelRepository.deleteById(id);
    }
}

# docker-compose.yaml
name: personeeldb
services:
  postgresql:
    image: postgres:17.4
    # volumes:
    #   - ~/volumes/jhipster/personeeldb/postgresql/:/var/lib/postgresql/data/
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_USER=personeeldb
      - POSTGRES_HOST_AUTH_METHOD=trust
    healthcheck:
      test: ['CMD-SHELL', 'pg_isready -U $${POSTGRES_USER}']
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 10
    # If you want to expose these ports outside your dev PC,
    # remove the "127.0.0.1:" prefix
    ports:
      - 127.0.0.1:5432:5432

Lesson 5 - Part 2
The DTO Pattern: A Restaurant Analogy üçΩÔ∏è
  • Kitchen = Database
    Where the raw ingredients and cooking happen, secret recipes, etc.
  • Dining Room = API
    Where customers interact with your restaurant, they see the menu, order food, pay, etc.
  • Waiters = Controllers
    Bridge between kitchen and customers
Lesson 5 - Part 3
The Problem: Exposing Your Kitchen üî•
  • Using Entity directly in Controller
    Equivalent to showing customers your messy kitchen with all its secrets! 

    // BAD: Showing the kitchen to customers
    @RestController
    public class PersoneelController {
        public Personeel getPersoneel() {
            return personeelRepository.findById(1L);
            // Returns everything: IDs, timestamps,
            // internal fields, kitchen secrets!
        }
    }
What's wrong with this?
  • Customers see internal kitchen details (IDs, timestamps)
  • You can't change your kitchen without affecting customers
  • Security risks (exposing sensitive data)
  • Tight coupling between kitchen and dining room
Lesson 5 - Part 4
The Solution: DTOs = The Menu üìã
üìö DTOs Explained
  • DTO (Data Transfer Object)
    Your restaurant's menu ‚Äì customers see only what they need 

// GOOD: Show customers only what they need to see

public class PersoneelDTO {
    private String title;      // On the menu
    private String author;     // On the menu
    private String description; // On the menu
    // NO internal kitchen details!
}

@RestController
public class PersoneelController {
    public PersoneelDTO getPersoneel() {
        Personeel kitchenPersoneel = personeelRepository.findById(1L);
        return convertToMenu(kitchenPersoneel); // Only show menu items
    }
}
Lesson 5 - Part 5
Real Code Example:
Entity (Kitchen Version):

@Entity
public class Personeel {
    @Id
    private Long id;           // Kitchen ID (internal)
    private String title;      // Menu item
    private String author;     // Menu item  
    private Date createdAt;    // Kitchen timestamp (internal)
    private String internalCode; // Kitchen secret (internal)
}
DTO (Menu Version):

public class PersoneelDTO {

    private String title;      // What customers see
    private String author;     // What customers see
    // No IDs, no timestamps, no internal codes!
}
Lesson 5 - Part 6
Why This Matters: üõ°Ô∏è

1. Security


// Entity exposes everything:

{
    "id": 123,
    "title": "Spring Boot Guide",
    "author": "John Doe",
    "internalCode": "SECRET_123",  // OOPS! Security leak!
    "createdBy": "admin"           // OOPS! Exposed internal user!
}
// DTO shows only safe fields:
{
    "title": "Spring Boot Guide",
    "author": "John Doe"
    // No security risks!
}

2. Flexibility


// You can change your kitchen without changing the menu:

public class Personeel {
    // Changed internal field names
    private Long internalId;       // Was 'id'
    private String personeelTitle;      // Was 'title'
    // Kitchen changed, menu stays the same!
}
public class PersoneelDTO {
    private String title;          // Menu unchanged!
    private String author;         // Menu unchanged!
}

3. Performance


// DTO lets you serve exactly what's needed:

public class PersoneelDTO {
    private String title;
    private String author;
    // No unnecessary data from database
}

    private String title;
    private String author;

    // Constructors

    }

// PersoneelController.java (modified)
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Optional;
import java.util.stream.Collectors;

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/personeel")
public class PersoneelController {

    private List personeel = new ArrayList<>();
    private Long nextId = 1L;

    public PersoneelController() {
        personeel.add(new Personeel(nextId++, "Personeel Title 1", "Personeel Author 1"));
        personeel.add(new Personeel(nextId++, "Personeel Title 2", "Personeel Author 2"));
    }

    @GetMapping
    public List getAllPersoneel() {
        return personeelRepository.findAll().stream()
                .map(this::convertToDto)
                .collect(Collectors.toList());
    }

    @PostMapping
    public PersoneelDTO createPersoneel(@RequestBody PersoneelDTO personeelDTO) {
        Personeel personeel = convertToEntity(personeelDTO);
        personeel = personeelRepository.save(personeel);
        return convertToDto(personeel);
    }

    private PersoneelDTO convertToDto(Personeel personeel) {
        return new PersoneelDTO(personeel.getId(), personeel.getTitle(), personeel.getAuthor());
    }

    private Personeel convertToEntity(PersoneelDTO personeelDTO) {
        Personeel personeel = new Personeel();
        personeel.setId(personeelDTO.getId()); // ID might be null for new personeel
        personeel.setTitle(personeelDTO.getTitle());
        personeel.setAuthor(personeelDTO.getAuthor());
        return personeel;
    }
}
Lesson 5 - Part 8
Exception Handling

üìö Exception Handling Strategies

  • Custom Exceptions
    Define specific exception types for domain-specific errors.
  • `@ControllerAdvice`
    Global handling of exceptions across multiple controllers.
  • `@ExceptionHandler`
    Annotate methods to handle specific exception types.
  • Error Response Structure
    Standardize error responses (e.g., JSON with error code and message).

üî¨ Lab: Implement Custom Exception

  1. Create a custom `PersoneelNotFoundException`
  2. Create `@ControllerAdvice` class to handle `PersoneelNotFoundException`
  3. Return appropriate HTTP status code (e.g., 404 Not Found)
  4. Modify `PersoneelController` to throw `PersoneelNotFoundException`
  5. Test with an invalid personeel ID: `http :8080/api/personeel/99`
Lesson 5 - Part 9
Custom Exception & Advice Code

// PersoneelNotFoundException.java
import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ResponseStatus;

@ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND)
public class PersoneelNotFoundException extends RuntimeException {
    public PersoneelNotFoundException(String message) {
        super(message);
    }
}

// GlobalExceptionHandler.java
import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ControllerAdvice;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ExceptionHandler;

@ControllerAdvice
public class GlobalExceptionHandler {

    @ExceptionHandler(PersoneelNotFoundException.class)
    public ResponseEntity handlePersoneelNotFoundException(PersoneelNotFoundException ex) {
        return new ResponseEntity<>(ex.getMessage(), HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND);
    }

    // Generic exception handler
    @ExceptionHandler(Exception.class)
    public ResponseEntity handleGenericException(Exception ex) {
        return new ResponseEntity<>("An unexpected error occurred: " + ex.getMessage(), HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR);
    }
}

// PersoneelController.java (modified for exception handling)
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.DeleteMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PutMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.ResponseStatus;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;
import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;

import java.util.List;

@RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/personeel")
public class PersoneelController {

    @Autowired
    private PersoneelRepository personeelRepository;

    @GetMapping
    public List getAllPersoneel() {
        return personeelRepository.findAll();
    }

    @GetMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel getPersoneelById(@PathVariable Long id) {
        return personeelRepository.findById(id)
                .orElseThrow(() -> new PersoneelNotFoundException("Personeel not found with ID: " + id));
    }

    @PostMapping
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.CREATED)
    public Personeel createPersoneel(@RequestBody Personeel personeel) {
        return personeelRepository.save(personeel);
    }

    @PutMapping("/{id}")
    public Personeel updatePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Personeel updatedPersoneel) {
        return personeelRepository.findById(id)
                .map(personeel -> {
                    personeel.setTitle(updatedPersoneel.getTitle());
                    personeel.setAuthor(updatedPersoneel.getAuthor());
                    return personeelRepository.save(personeel);
                })
                .orElseThrow(() -> new PersoneelNotFoundException("Personeel not found with ID: " + id));
    }

    @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
    @ResponseStatus(HttpStatus.NO_CONTENT)
    public void deletePersoneel(@PathVariable Long id) {
        if (!personeelRepository.existsById(id)) {
            throw new PersoneelNotFoundException("Personeel not found with ID: " + id);
        }
        personeelRepository.deleteById(id);
    }
}
